wikipedia_page.main: Alan William Lillington  (born 4 September 1932) is a British sprinter. He competed in the men's 100 metres at the 1952 Summer Olympics. He represented England in the sprint disciplines at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Vancouver, Canada.Lillington studied Medicine at Durham University. He later became a consultant paediatrician in Sunderland and was awarded the MBE IN 1995. He is the father of former rugby player Peter Lillington.
